  }} |Section3= {{Chembox Hazards
|  MainHazards= FlashPt= Autoignition=
  }} }} 'Deoxycytidine' is a deoxyribonucleoside, a component of
  deoxyribonucleic acid. It is similar to the ribonucleoside cytidine, but with
  one hydroxyl group removed from the 2' position.

Deoxycytidine can be phosphorylated by deoxycytidine kinase (DCK).
